src.train package

Submodules

src.train.callbacks module

PyTorch Lightning callbacks. Callbacks are used to perform actions at various events during training and inference. For example, ModelCheckpoint callback saves the best model based on the validation loss.

class src.train.callbacks.ModelCheckpoint(save_top_k: int = 2, monitor: str = 'Validation/Mean absolute error', mode: str = 'min', dir_path: str = '/content/checkpoints', filename: str = 'base-{epoch:02d}-{Validation/Mean absolute error:.2f}', **kwargs)

Bases: ModelCheckpoint

Model checkpoint callback. Saves the best model based on the validation loss.

class src.train.callbacks.VisualizePrediction(num_samples: int = 3)

Bases: Callback

Visualize the prediction and ground truth for the first num_samples in the validation dataset.

on_validation_end(trainer: Trainer, pl_module: LightningModule) → None

Visualize the prediction and ground truth for the first num_samples in the validation dataset. The images are logged to the wandb logger.

Parameters:

  • trainer – PyTorch Lightning trainer.

  • pl_module – PyTorch Lightning module.

Return type:

pl.Trainer

Return type:

pl.LightningModule

src.train.losses module

Loss functions for training.

class src.train.losses.L1Loss(normalize: bool = False, ignore_values: int | float = 0, reduction: str = 'mean')

Bases: Module

L1 loss with ignore regions.

forward(out: Tensor, label: Tensor) → Tensor

Forward step of the loss.

Parameters:

  • out (torch.Tensor) – Output of the model.

  • label (torch.Tensor) – Ground truth.

Returns:

Loss value.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

src.train.train module

Training module. It contains LightningModel class that is a wrapper around the model that handles forward step, loss calculation, optimizer and learning rate scheduler.

class src.train.train.CallableObjectProtocol(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Protocol

Protocol for callable objects.

class src.train.train.LightningModel(model: Module, optimizer: str, learning_rate: float, loss: CallableObjectProtocol, lr_scheduler_params: dict | None)

Bases: LightningModule

Lightning model class. It is a wrapper around the model that handles forward step, loss calculation, optimizer and learning rate scheduler.

calculate_loss(prediction: Tensor, ground_truth: Tensor) → FloatTensor

Calculates loss between prediction and ground truth on the pixels.

Parameters:

  • prediction (torch.Tensor) – Prediction of the model.

  • ground_truth – Ground truth.

Returns:

Loss value.

configure_optimizers()

Configures optimizers and learning rate schedulers.

Returns:

Optimizers and learning rate schedulers.

Return type:

List[torch.optim.Optimizer], List[Dict[str, Any]]

forward_step(batch, batch_idx, state='Train') → Tensor

Forward step of the model.

Parameters:

  • batch (Dict[str, torch.Tensor]) – Batch of data.

  • batch_idx (int) – Index of the batch.

  • state (str) – State of the model.

Returns:

Loss value.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

on_fit_start()

Sets seed for reproducibility.

Training step of the model.

Parameters:

  • batch_idx (int) – Index of the batch.

Returns:

Loss value.

  • batch_idx (int) – Index of the batch.

Returns:

Utility functions for training.

Calculates the learning rate scheduler kwargs.

Parameters:

  • batch_size (int) – Batch size.

  • accumulate_grad_batches (int) – Accumulate gradient batches.

Returns:

Learning rate scheduler kwargs.
